arguments.name: Number_s
arguments.description: The number of successes in trials.

arguments.name: Probability_s
arguments.description: The probability of success on each trial.

arguments.name: Cumulative
arguments.description: A logical value that determines the form of the function. If cumulative is TRUE, then BINOMDIST returns the cumulative distribution function, which is the probability that there are at most number_s successes; if FALSE, it returns the probability mass function, which is the probability that there are number_s successes.
